plugins.name: Spacing and radius fixer
plugins.description:
Auto-fix spacing & radius

Plugin that automatically rounds spacing and radius values to the nearest preset value in Auto Layout objects.


What it does

- Rounds gap and padding values to the nearest preset spacing

- Rounds corner radius to the nearest preset radius

- Works with any Auto Layout object (frames, components, instances)


Presets

Default values (can be customized in plugin):

Spacing: 0, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 16, 20, 24, 32, 40, 48, 56, 64, 80 (px)

Radius: 0, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 16, 20, 100 (px)


How to use

1. Select Auto Layout object(s)

2. Run the plugin

3. Switch between Spacing/Radius modes

4. Customize presets if needed (or use Reset to restore defaults)

5. Click Apply
plugins.tagline: Fixes inconsistent spacing and radius values by rounding them to the nearest preset

plugins.name: Lexi: Localize & Translate your design

üöÄ Why Lexi?

50+ languages ‚Äì Translate your designs into multiple languages in seconds.

Batch translation ‚Äì Select multiple frames & languages at once.

Seamless workflow ‚Äì Translated frames stay organized with clear naming.



üîß How It Works

Select your frames ‚Äì Pick the designs you need to translate.

Choose your languages ‚Äì Supports all major languages, including English, Spanish, Japanese, Arabic, and more.

Translate with AI ‚Äì Lexi uses OpenAI‚Äôs GPT-3.5 Turbo for high-quality, natural translations.

Get organized output ‚Äì New frames are created, named with language codes, and maintain the original design structure.


üîí Best Practices

Who is Lexi for?

plugins.name: Fig Toolkit
plugins.description:
Fig Toolkit is your all-in-one Figma companion, focused on helping designers sort, align, and organise their workspace faster and more intuitively. With powerful sorting tools, renaming capabilities, and precise alignment options, you can bring structure and clarity to any design layout. For those managing text consistency, the toolkit also scans and identifies unstyled or mixed text layers, making it easy to apply or update text styles.


üîπ Easily sort and rename layers

üîπ Precisely align elements with adjustable spacing

üîπ Wrap layers into new sections with custom padding

üîπ Reorder layers directly in the layers panel

üîπ Detect mixed or unstyled fonts

üîπ View and fix text layers missing styles

üîπ Apply or update text styles quickly

üîπ Streamline your design workflow with ease
plugins.tagline: Sort, Align & Manage Styles in Figma Effortlessly

plugins.name: Component Boss (Beta)
plugins.description:
Figma Component Boss is a powerful plugin that helps designers efficiently manage components with just a few clicks. Whether you need to convert multiple objects into a master component with linked instances or replace selected objects with an existing component, this plugin streamlines the process‚Äîsaving time and maintaining consistency in your designs.


How It Works


üîπ Create Component from Selection ‚Äì Select multiple objects and instantly turn them into a master component with instances, keeping styles, auto-layout, and hierarchy intact.

üîπ Link to Existing Component ‚Äì Pick a target component and replace selected objects with instances of that component while preserving positions and layout.


Why Use It?


‚úÖ Maintain proper component-instance relationships

‚úÖ Preserve all auto-layout settings, styles, and nested structures

‚úÖ Seamlessly convert objects into reusable instances

‚úÖ Improve workflow efficiency and consistency


Designed for both individual designers and teams, Figma Component Master ensures your design system remains clean, organized, and scalable. Try it now and simplify your component workflow!
plugins.tagline: Supercharge Your Design Workflow

plugins.name: Fixiq ‚Äî Fix the scale of working area
plugins.description:
Intro

In Figma, the current scale is not shown anywhere on the canvas. You can‚Äôt see how far you have moved from the actual scale of the frame. You can only select the frame and see its dimensions. And then estimate the ratio of pixels to percentages.


In Figma, you can zoom in to 100% once using hotkeys. But any movement on the board can lead to an accidental change in scale.


Solution

Fixiq not only fixes the 100% scale, but can also change it to 50%, 100%, 200%.


Plugin will be useful not only for designers, but also for managers. With Fixiq you can easily design interfaces of non-standard sizes/proportions and be sure about the scale you're working with. Your layouts will always be in the actual/original size. Managers can present project results to clients without irritating zooming.

accepted.name: Roman Nebel
accepted.description: IT Manager / UX Expert / Pet-projects Developer

plugins.tagline: Figma plugin that fixes the scale of working area

plugins.name: Layer Organizer
plugins.description:
Layer Organizer

Is your Figma file a mess? Layers all over the place? Layer Organizer instantly organizes, groups, and aligns your selected layers ‚Äî with real-time visual feedback.


üöÄ Core Features:

  1. Auto Layer Organization: Instantly arranges and aligns selected layers for a clean, structured layout.
  2. Group Level Selection (1‚Äì5): Groups layers based on / in their names (e.g., Button/Primary), supporting deep hierarchies.
  3. Horizontal & Vertical Spacing: Set precise spacing between groups and layers. Quick presets: 200px, 400px, 1000px.
  4. Combine Single Layers: Merge single-layer groups into one clean ‚ÄúUngrouped‚Äù group. Toggleable.


üëÄ Preview & Visualization:

  1. Real-Time Preview: See changes instantly as you organize.
  2. Group View: Visual list of group names and included layers, with type labels (Frame, Component, Vector, etc.).


‚öôÔ∏è Settings & Shortcuts:

  1. Preference Memory: Automatically remembers your last settings for a smoother workflow.
  2. Default Values: Horizontal/Vertical spacing: 100px, Group level: 1, Combine single-layer groups: On.


‚ö° Performance-First Architecture:

  1. Two-Stage Processing: Measures first, positions after ‚Äî for faster, more accurate results.
  2. Safe Layer Sorting: Uses a temporary frame to reorder layers while preserving hierarchy and structure.


Organize! Preview! Perfect! üßº
plugins.tagline: Auto-arrange and group layers for a cleaner, more organized Figma canvas. üßº

plugins.name: SVG Exporter
plugins.description:
Este plugin te permite exportar elementos gr√°ficos (assets) en formato SVG desde cualquier Frame que selecciones en Figma. Al ejecutarlo:

1. El plugin detecta autom√°ticamente los vectores, √≠conos y componentes dentro del frame seleccionado.

2. Muestra una lista con vista previa de cada asset, su nombre y tipo (VECTOR, LINE, COMPONENT, etc.).

3. Puedes filtrar por tipo, seleccionar o deseleccionar assets individualmente o todos a la vez.

4. Al hacer clic en ‚ÄúExportar selecci√≥n‚Äù, los archivos se descargan en un ZIP listo para usar.


Uso paso a paso:

‚Ä¢ Selecciona un Frame que contenga los assets que deseas exportar.

‚Ä¢ Ejecuta el plugin.

‚Ä¢ Filtra, selecciona y exporta.


Limitaciones actuales:

‚Ä¢ Solo funciona si seleccionas un Frame (no soporta m√∫ltiples frames a la vez).

‚Ä¢ Solo exporta elementos compatibles con formato SVG.

‚Ä¢ No incluye im√°genes rasterizadas, texto plano ni auto layout como exportables.

‚Ä¢ No detecta autom√°ticamente cambios de selecci√≥n; requiere usar el bot√≥n ‚ÄúActualizar selecci√≥n‚Äù.



-----------------------------------------


This plugin lets you export graphical elements (assets) as SVG files from any selected Frame in Figma.


When you run the plugin:

1. It scans the selected frame for valid exportable elements (e.g., VECTORS, ICONS, COMPONENTS).

2. You‚Äôll see a list of assets with preview thumbnails, names, and their Figma types.

3. You can filter by type, toggle selection, and bulk-select assets.

4. Clicking ‚ÄúExport Selection‚Äù downloads all selected assets as a clean ZIP file of SVGs.


How to use it:

‚Ä¢ Select a Frame that contains the assets you want to export.

‚Ä¢ Launch the plugin.

‚Ä¢ Use the filters, select assets, and export.


Current limitations:

‚Ä¢ Only one Frame can be selected at a time.

‚Ä¢ Only elements that support SVG export will be included (e.g., no bitmaps or text layers).

‚Ä¢ Does not automatically react to new selections ‚Äî use the ‚ÄúRefresh Selection‚Äù button manually when needed.
plugins.tagline: Exporta f√°cilmente assets SVG desde frames seleccionados en Figma, con vista previa y filtros.

plugins.name: Yet Another Design Linter
plugins.description:
‚ú® Yet Another Design Linter (YADL): Your Design System's Enforcer

YADL is the essential Figma plugin for teams who care about consistency, scalability, and design system integrity. Automate linting, enforce variable use, and ship cleaner designs‚Äîfast.


üöÄ Why use it?

Design systems aren't just style guides‚Äîthey're contracts. YADL automates enforcing those contracts so you're not stuck playing pixel cop.


üîç What it does:

‚Ä¢ Variable-Aware Linting + Auto-Fix: Instantly checks padding, gap, radius, stroke width, fills, strokes, effects, and typography‚Äîflags rogue values and suggests or auto-applies matching design tokens.


‚Ä¢ Smart Error Grouping: See issues grouped by type and value with intelligent prioritization; focus on what matters most.


‚Ä¢ Typography Linting: Comprehensive checks for font family, size, weight, line height, and letter spacing consistency.


‚Ä¢ Deleted Variable Detection: Identifies broken variable references and optionally auto-detaches them to prevent errors.


‚Ä¢ Component Structure Analysis: Detects nested components that may cause performance issues.


‚Ä¢ Accessibility Checks: Flags common a11y pitfalls for inclusive design.


‚Ä¢ Flexible Layer Filtering: Configurable options to include/exclude hidden or locked layers.


‚Ä¢ Strict Linting Mode: Enhanced validation rules for production-ready designs.


‚Ä¢ Variable Collection Control: Choose which variable collections to include in suggestions.


‚Ä¢ Persistent UI State: Remembers window size and settings for smoother workflow.


‚Ä¢ Precise Value Suggestions: See exact px values next to each suggestion‚Äîno guessing.


‚Ä¢ Resizable, Accessible UI: Resize handle + full keyboard navigation for better UX.


üö¶ It detects:

‚úÖ Generic layer names (e.g., "Frame 1", "Rectangle 2")

‚úÖ Absolute positioning inside auto layout

‚úÖ All padding types (left, right, top, bottom, horizontal, vertical) not using variables

‚úÖ Gap, border radius, stroke width not using variables

‚úÖ Fill colors, stroke colors, effects not using variables

‚úÖ Typography properties (font family, size, weight, line height, letter spacing) not using variables

‚úÖ Broken variable references from deleted design tokens

‚úÖ Nested components causing potential performance issues

‚úÖ Issues in hidden or locked layers (configurable)


üé® How it works:

1. Run the plugin in your Figma file.

2. Review errors categorized by type (Core Design, Spacing & Layout, Visual Properties, Typography, Variable Management, Component Structure).

3. Apply auto-suggestions with one click or fix issues manually.

4. Configure settings to match your team's workflow and design system.


üí° Who it's for:

‚Ä¢ Designers who care about clean, token-driven files

‚Ä¢ Teams enforcing scalable, maintainable design systems

‚Ä¢ Design system managers ensuring consistency across projects

‚Ä¢ Developers who need structured, handoff-ready designs

‚Ä¢ Teams transitioning to variable-based design workflows


üéØ Perfect for:

‚Ä¢ Design system audits and cleanup

‚Ä¢ Onboarding new team members to design standards

‚Ä¢ Pre-handoff quality checks

‚Ä¢ Maintaining design token consistency at scale


Made with ‚ù§Ô∏è for the Adtraction design team by Jonatan D. Bjerrek√¶r.


YADL: Keep your Figma files clean, scalable, and system-perfect‚Äîautomatically.
plugins.tagline: Keep your Figma files clean, consistent, and design-system perfect‚Äîautomatically.

plugins.name: Syntax Highlighter
plugins.description:
How to use


Applying syntax highlighting colors


  1. Select a text layer containing a code snippet.
  2. Choose a programming language, if required (the plugin will try to identify the language automatically).
  3. Choose a theme.
  4. Toggle include background and line numbers, if required.
  5. Click Apply.


Clearing syntax highlighting colors


  1. Select a text layer containing a formatted code snippet.
  2. Click the Clear formatting button.


Adding custom Visual Studio themes


  1. Open Visual Studio Code.
  2. Install the desired color theme and switch to the theme in Visual Studio Code.
  3. Press Ctrl + Shift + P and run Developer: Generate Color Theme from current settings.
  4. Select the file's contents and copy.
  5. Open the Figma plugin and press the Create a new theme button.
  6. Paste into the Create a new theme dialog and click Save.


Note: This plugin supports up to 10 custom themes.

accepted.description: The official account for Microsoft Design.

plugins.tagline: Apply syntax highlighting colors to code snippets.

plugins.name: Heurator
plugins.description:
Elevate your design critique process with Heurator, a powerful Figma plugin that brings Nielsen's 10 Usability Heuristics directly into your workflow.


Document, visualize, and solve usability issues with precision‚Äîall without leaving your design files.


‚úì Pinpoint violations with customizable severity ratings

‚úì Generate visually striking evaluation cards linked to problem areas

‚úì Create actionable recommendations to improve user experience

‚úì Maintain consistent evaluation criteria across your team


Even in the age of AI-generated interfaces, human-centered heuristic evaluation remains essential. While AI excels at creating visually appealing designs, it often misses nuanced usability concerns that experienced designers catch. Heurator bridges this gap by helping you apply proven principles to any interface‚Äîwhether human or AI-designed‚Äîensuring truly intuitive experiences.


Transform complex usability principles into practical insights and deliver more thoughtful, user-centered designs with Heurator.

plugins.name: FigCrawl
plugins.description:
FigCrawl: Your FigJam Content Extractor


What is FigCrawl?

FigCrawl is a powerful FigJam plugin that transforms your collaborative boards into structured, AI-ready data. It intelligently extracts and organizes all your board's content while preserving the visual hierarchy and relationships between elements.


Use Cases

For Designers & Teams

  1. Extract structured content from brainstorming sessions
  2. Convert visual collaboration into actionable data
  3. Document and archive board content
  4. Share board content in a structured format


For AI/LLM Integration

  1. Feed board content into AI tools
  2. Generate summaries and reports
  3. Analyze relationships between ideas
  4. Create structured documentation


For Documentation

  1. Export board content for documentation
  2. Create structured reports
  3. Archive important board sessions
  4. Share insights with stakeholders



How It Works

  1. Launch: Open the plugin in your FigJam board
  2. Extract: Click "Extract Content" to scan your board
  3. Review: See a summary of extracted content
  4. Copy: Choose to copy the entire board or individual pages
  5. Use: Paste the JSON into your preferred AI tool or LLM
plugins.tagline: Extract FigJam content into AI-ready data with one click

plugins.name: Private Notes
plugins.description:
Private Notes allows you to attach personal annotations to any layer in your Figma file that remain completely private to you.


  1. Truly Private: Notes are stored locally and their contents are only visible to you, never to other collaborators
  2. Visual Markers: Customisable markers show where you've left notes (only visible when you run the plugin)
  3. Flexible Positioning: Place note markers in 8 different positions around your layers that stay fixed to the right frame.
  4. Persistent Storage: Your notes remain attached to layers even when you close and reopen Figma


Perfect for designers who want to keep track of personal thoughts, reminders, and to-dos without cluttering the file with comments visible to everyone.


Use it for recording client feedback, noting implementation details, or leaving yourself breadcrumbs for areas that need further attention.


Please contact me for any feedback. suggestions or issues!

Introduction

Image Size Integration allows Figma users to efficiently manage and integrate images within frames, groups, and components. With this plugin, you can adjust image sizes and apply uniform dimensions for a consistent design output.


Function Description

  1. Allows users to select multiple elements (Frames, Groups, Components, Text, Instances, etc.) in a Figma design.
  2. Automatically calculates the maximum width and height from the selected elements.
  3. Displays each selected image inside a preview box, either maintaining its original size or resizing it based on the longest side, as determined by the user's settings.
  4. A toggle feature to switch between maintaining the image's original size or scaling it to fit the preview box.
  5. Supports flexible control over how images are displayed within their allocated preview space.


How to Use

  1. Select the elements (Frames, Groups, Text, Components, Instances, etc.) you want to preview and adjust.
  2. Click the "Generate Base64 Preview" button to create image previews.
  3. Use the toggle to switch between keeping the image‚Äôs original size or scaling it to fit the preview box.
  4. View the adjusted images and their corresponding dimensions directly within the plugin's interface.


Notes

  1. The plugin supports both raster images and vector elements.
  2. Images will be displayed in a fixed-size preview box, and resizing settings apply based on your toggle choice.
  3. The plugin works with selected elements in Figma's canvas, so ensure you have the right items selected before applying the tool.
